item.title: SSH Port Forwarding
item.description: Something I do regulary is accessing a port from a server from my local machine. For this we use SSH Tunneling and the technique called port forwarding. The structure of the command is as follows: ssh -L [REMOTE_PORT]:LOCAL_ADDRESS:LOCAL_PORT USER@REMOTE_ADDRESS To avoid login a session on the server, and send this task to process on background, we can add this flags: ssh -L [REMOTE_PORT]:LOCAL_ADDRESS:LOCAL_PORT -Nf USER@REMOTE_ADDRESS And if you want to create a shortcut for this using a shell script, you can use this gist as a template.
